contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} In [[cinematography]] and [[photography]], '''pre-flashing''' is the exposure of the [[film]] or other photosensor to uniform [[light]] prior to exposing it to the scene to be imaged. This adds a bias to the overall light input recorded by the sensor. It is sometimes used for artistic effects, as it can be used to add a [[colour]] cast to [[shadow]]s without significantly affecting highlights. It is also used in fields such as [[astronomy]] to bias [[Charge-coupled device|CCD]] image sensors into a linear region, improving their low-light sensitivity. == See also == * [[Photographic hypersensitization]] * [[Pre-flash metering]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Pre-Flashing}} [[Category:Photographic techniques]] {{Photo-stub}}
